lines.text: "There's a cure for everything except death."
"Why should I kill myself worrying when I'll end up just as dead?"

[Addressing a young man seated before her, apparently seeking advice on his love life]
You must plant your seeds in another field. Do you understand what I mean?
It's simple, my boy. What good is planting seeds if the soil rejects them? You plant, but don't gather. Understand?

[Becoming impatient]
She doesn't love you! Forget her!

[Pausing for effect]
Dear boy, you're very ugly. Yes, ugly. There are so many other women... Go and plow another field!
Your mother and her prayers can't help us.
I mind my own business, I bother nobody, and what do I get? Trouble.
I've been cursed since the day I was born.

[He and his son are at a restaurant; together they notice a nearby table, occupied by an apparently well-off family who seem to be eating quite well]
To eat like that, you'd have to earn at least a million a month.
